guide.description: Know your pot, treat your pot well, and it will become your most capable partner in the kitchen

guide.selectDescription: Click the cards below to view detailed usage guides
guide.clickToView: Click to view complete usage guide

iron.name: Nitrided Iron Wok
iron.subtitle: Nitrided Iron Wok
iron.description: Born for pursuing ultimate wok hei, the soul choice for Chinese stir-frying and braising
iron.suitable: Suitable for stir-frying, braising, dry-frying and other Chinese cooking methods
iron.skill: Requires professional seasoning and maintenance techniques
iron.title: Nitrided Iron Wok Usage Guide

heatControl.title: Heat Control & Dry Heating
heatControl.content1: Iron woks conduct heat quickly. Use medium-low heat for preheating and avoid prolonged dry heating to prevent damage. Heat the wok before adding oil for better non-stick performance.
heatControl.content2: Start with medium-low heat (3-4 setting) then switch to high heat (5+ setting). Direct high heat can burn food and damage the wok surface.

protein.title: High-protein Ingredients
protein.description: Eggs, soft tofu, fish skin: Master the hot wok cold oil technique, or pre-treat ingredients with flour coating.

ginger.title: Ginger Anti-stick
ginger.description: For dishes with ginger, rub the hot wok bottom with ginger slices before stir-frying or deep-frying.

starch.title: High-starch Ingredients
starch.description: Potatoes, yam: Rinse with water to remove surface starch after cutting, and drain thoroughly.

sugar.title: High-sugar Dishes
sugar.description: Use more oil and stir-fry quickly. For rice cakes and noodles: soak in water first to moisten surface, use more oil and stir quickly.

rust.title: Rust Risk
rust.description: Do not soak the wok for long periods or store food overnight. Avoid cooking acidic dishes like tomatoes or vinegar to protect the oil coating.

maintenance.title: Wok Care Tutorial: Make It Your Family Heirloom

firstTime.title: Step 1: Initial Seasoning (Crucial)
firstTime.purpose: Purpose: Remove industrial rust-prevention coating, establish initial oil layer, lay foundation for future non-stick performance.

clean.title: Clean
clean.description: Under running warm water, thoroughly clean inside and outside with dish soap and scrubber, then dry.

dry.title: Dry
dry.description: Place wok back in cooker, select manual mode, set to level 3 for about 1 minute.

oil.title: Oil
oil.description: Add cooking oil, start preset seasoning recipe, run at low speed for about 2 minutes.

wait.title: Rest
wait.description: After cooling, wipe excess oil with paper towels.

daily.title: Step 2: Daily Care (Simple but Consistent)
daily.purpose: Purpose: Strengthen and thicken oil layer, make iron wok darker, shinier, and more non-stick with use.

clean.title: Cleaning
tips: After cooking, clean with warm water and soft tools (bamboo brush, sponge, soft cloth) while wok is still warm
Use minimal or no dish soap to protect oil layer
For stuck food, soak in warm water then clean
Never use steel wool or hard scrubbers

care.title: Care
care.dryTip: Drying is key: After cleaning, place wok back in cooker for 1-2 minutes, or dry thoroughly with cloth
care.oilTip: Oiling is enhancement: While still warm after drying, apply thin layer of cooking oil on inner surface
care.storageTip: Long-term storage: If not using for extended periods, apply oil layer and store in dry place

rustNote.title: About Rust
rustNote.description: If rust appears, remove with white vinegar or scrubber, then repeat the complete initial seasoning process for renewal.

teflon.name: Teflon Non-stick Pot
teflon.subtitle: Teflon Non-stick Pot
teflon.description: Designed specifically for handling delicate ingredients, making non-stick cooking and maintaining food appearance incredibly easy
teflon.suitable: Suitable for pan-frying, stir-frying, and sauce-based cooking
teflon.protection: Coating protection is the core point of use
teflon.title: Teflon Non-stick Pot Usage Guide

noMetal.title: Strictly No Metal Utensils
noMetal.description: Never use metal or hard utensils (steel spatula, steel wool). Always use silicone or wooden utensils.

noSharp.title: Avoid Sharp Ingredients
noSharp.description: Do not cook ingredients with sharp shells (crabs, clams) to avoid coating scratches during stir-frying.

noDryBurn.title: Avoid Dry Heating
noDryBurn.description: Prolonged dry heating will permanently damage the non-stick coating.

gentle.title: Gentle Cleaning
gentle.description: After natural cooling, use regular dish soap or clean with sponge/soft cloth and warm water.

temperature.title: Prevent Temperature Shock
temperature.description: Never rinse hot pot with cold water directly - temperature difference is the coating's invisible killer. If cleaning while hot, use hot water only.

stain.title: Stain Treatment
stain.description: For stubborn stains, soak in warm water. Never scrape forcefully.

spray.title: Avoid High-pressure Water
spray.description: Do not use equipment's built-in water spray directly on pot interior as it accelerates coating aging.

inspection.title: Regular Inspection
inspection.description: When coating shows obvious scratches or significantly reduced non-stick performance, we recommend contacting for repair or pot replacement for optimal cooking results and food safety.

supplies.title: Supplies Purchase Guide
supplies.subtitle: Supplies Purchase Guide
supplies.description: Purchasing and replacement guide for accessories and consumables to ensure continuous efficient operation of equipment

seals.title: Seal Ring Components
seals.check: Recommend checking sealing performance every 6 months
seals.replace: Replace immediately when aging or damage is found

filters.title: Filter Components
filters.replace: Replace new filters when severely clogged

silicone.title: Silicone Utensil Set
silicone.description: Safe utensils specifically for Teflon non-stick pots
silicone.includes: Includes spatula, ladle, tongs and other tools

wood.title: Wooden Utensil Set
wood.description: Traditional utensils suitable for nitrided iron woks
wood.material: Natural materials, won't damage pot surface

whenToReplace.title: When to Replace
whenToReplace.seals: Seal rings show aging, hardening, or cracking
whenToReplace.filters: Filters severely clogged with poor cleaning results
